Question
========
Read the following statements:
*Statement I:*
Overall, between-subjects designs require more participants than within- subjects designs.

*Statement II:*
A single-factor experimental design (i.e., with one independent variable) must include at least two conditions.

Answerlist
----------
* Both statements are true
* I is true, II is false
* I is false, I is true
* Both are false


Solution
========
Within-subjects designs require less participants than between subjects-designs, because differences between individuals matters less in the former design. Furthermore, if we only have one independent variable, it must consist of at least 2 conditions that will be compared to each other.
